groups.name: GreatX
groups.title: GreatX
groups.bio_raw: GreatX, May 2018 **Team Mission:** To help our members to have a better life, with deeper and more meaningful relationships. GreatX supports members when they need support but we're not always about growth exercises — we enjoy a balance between work and play, that camaraderie is an important element of team work and play. **Meetings:** We meet on Mondays from 6:30-9:00 pm, at various locations in the South Bay. Some members bring dinner and come early for some socializing. We're open to having visitors and rotators as long as they are as handsome, wealthy, and charismatic as the team members are. **[Team Standards](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1yK8G3MGUE1Lo0r_F0dNFlC8Q2CQpff16UQ9-HH-pEdU/edit?usp=sharing)** **Status as a Tempo Team:** We give back to Momentum and grow stronger as a team by committing to hosting breakfast. **Membership and Visitor Status:** GreatX is open to visitors by prior arrangement and is not presently seeking new members. **Members:** * Howard Bailey * Matt Hill * Dave Mahal * Brad Milliken * active user * Joe Sabolefski * Bob Silver * Geoff Wright **Distant members:** * Baruch Deutsch * Brad Peppard _GreatX camping trip September 2010 (with ex-members Joe, Marco, Mark, Francis, and mascot Colby)_
groups.bio_cooked:
GreatX, May 2018

Team Mission: To help our members to have a better life, with deeper and more meaningful relationships. GreatX supports members when they need support but we’re not always about growth exercises — we enjoy a balance between work and play, that camaraderie is an important element of team work and play.

Meetings: We meet on Mondays from 6:30-9:00 pm, at various locations in the South Bay. Some members bring dinner and come early for some socializing. We’re open to having visitors and rotators as long as they are as handsome, wealthy, and charismatic as the team members are.

Team Standards

Status as a Tempo Team: We give back to Momentum and grow stronger as a team by committing to hosting breakfast.

Membership and Visitor Status: GreatX is open to visitors by prior arrangement and is not presently seeking new members.

Members:

  • Howard Bailey
  • Matt Hill
  • Dave Mahal
  • Brad Milliken
  • active user
  • Joe Sabolefski
  • Bob Silver
  • Geoff Wright

Distant members:

  • Baruch Deutsch
  • Brad Peppard

GreatX camping trip September 2010 (with ex-members Joe, Marco, Mark, Francis, and mascot Colby)
groups.membership_request_template: Team membership generally requires consensus of the team members.

groups.name: Tech
groups.membership_request_template: Members helping out on web and Discourse Technical issues.

groups.name: RetiredEdge
groups.title: RetiredEdge
groups.bio_raw: **Team Mission:** Our Team is a valued resource and connection for Men that are retired or planning for retirement. We collectively bring and share compelling and thought-provoking content and experience through our lifelong connections and learnings as we boomers jump off the treadmill in search for more meaning in our lives. **Meeting Information:** We meet the second Thursday of the month from 12:00 - 2:00, at a minimum. Additional _ad hoc_ meetings and adventures are also scheduled to pursue fun and rewarding Team activities. Venues for these meetings will change to accommodate the activity we have chosen to do. **About the Team:** Retired Edge started in 2016 and currently has upwards of 17 members, many of whom are also members of other teams. Retired Edge is open to any Momentum member who has retired from a full time career or is partially retired, or seriously contemplating near-term retirement. **Our Standards:** • Show up to meetings on time, • Inform the group advance if you have to miss a meeting. • Come prepared to “tell on yourself” – be ready to reveal your most pressing issues • Be prepared to listen during shares, focusing your full attention. **Status as a Tempo Team:** We give back to Momentum and grow stronger as a team by committing to: • Breakfast • Content • Fun • Proving Grove **Membership and Visitor Status:** Retired Edge is open to visitors and new members in keeping with it's theme and standards. Certain activities may also be open to general Momentum membership if the topic is one we feel could benefit a larger circle of Men.
groups.bio_cooked:
Team Mission: Our Team is a valued resource and connection for Men that are retired or planning for retirement. We collectively bring and share compelling and thought-provoking content and experience through our lifelong connections and learnings as we boomers jump off the treadmill in search for more meaning in our lives.

Meeting Information: We meet the second Thursday of the month from 12:00 - 2:00, at a minimum. Additional ad hoc meetings and adventures are also scheduled to pursue fun and rewarding Team activities. Venues for these meetings will change to accommodate the activity we have chosen to do.

About the Team: Retired Edge started in 2016 and currently has upwards of 17 members, many of whom are also members of other teams. Retired Edge is open to any Momentum member who has retired from a full time career or is partially retired, or seriously contemplating near-term retirement.

Our Standards: • Show up to meetings on time, • Inform the group advance if you have to miss a meeting. • Come prepared to “tell on yourself” – be ready to reveal your most pressing issues • Be prepared to listen during shares, focusing your full attention.

Status as a Tempo Team: We give back to Momentum and grow stronger as a team by committing to: • Breakfast • Content • Fun • Proving Grove

Membership and Visitor Status: Retired Edge is open to visitors and new members in keeping with it’s theme and standards. Certain activities may also be open to general Momentum membership if the topic is one we feel could benefit a larger circle of Men.

groups.name: InboundInquiry
groups.title: Inbound Inquiry Support
groups.bio_raw: A group inbox where emails sent via the gomomentum.org contact page will end up. Any member of this group should be able to respond to such support requests. Optionally, a 'support coordinator' can take charge of assigning incoming emails to a member of the support response team.

groups.name: NewOwnersCouncil
groups.title: New Owners Council
groups.bio_raw:
The **New Owners Council** oversees the process of new owners entering Momentum, from first contact via the website or Meetup through their initial Launchpad team experience. 

- Our forward-facing brand along with gomentum.org, Meetup and Facebook

- Welcoming new men when they show up at general meetings or team visits

- Forming and leading Launchpad teams

- Placing men on teams when Launchpad does not work for them (logistics, etc.)

- Making sure formed teams remain stable

- Exit interviews of men who choose to exit Momentum.

**About Launchpad**

Momentum’s Launchpad team experience is very similar to other Momentum teams, but centered around new men. In order to quickly demonstrate Momentum’s value proposition to new men, the meetings are designed to be more experiential and less verbal instruction. 

Momentum teams create a safe space for men to be vulnerable and visible to their teammates. Creating a safe space builds the trust and confidence men need to be open about what’s really going on in their lives. To create the full experience, it is important that new men learn how to feel safe enough to offer honest feedback to the other men. 

Launchpad is experiential: it demonstrates two-way, peer-to-peer vulnerability, man to man. New men learn how their contributions to other men are as important as what they bring away for themselves. 

Launchpad offers a unique bonding experience for new men because they often share similar, recent major life events, e.g. a divorce, which tends to make the men more equally motivated as they launch into men’s work. 

Launchpad is designed to teach Momentum concepts as they come up in context along the way to new men forming a compelling value proposition for being part of Momentum. Once that basic value proposition is in place, Launchpad men are ready for more formalized curriculums like Expedition.

**About Expedition**

While Launchpad is designed to demonstrate the basic team experience for a new man, Expedition is designed to offer the next instructive step, once a new man is motivated to:

1. Experience and integrate the fundamentals of Momentum, 
2. Connect with more new men and Momentum veterans, and 
3. Develop a deeper, authentic connection to the larger Momentum community.

Expedition is a systematic, streamlined training course that uses pre-recorded videos, podcasts, online readings and reflections, interactive video conferences, online discussions, and experiential face-to-face trainings. Upon completing Expedition, men gain a deeper sense of self, their relationship with their masculinity, with other men, and their reasons for being in Momentum.
